qas.question: What was the focus of paintings in Italy?
Where was the focus of paintings on textures and surfaces?
What painter was an early champion of oil as a medium in painting?
Jan van Eyck's paintings are known for what characteristics?
What wasn't the focus of paintings in Italy?
Where wasn't the focus of paintings on textures and surfaces?
What painter was a late champion of oil as a medium in painting?
What painter wasn't an early champion of oil as a medium in painting?
Jan van Eyck's paintings are unknown for what characteristics?

context: The ideas of the Italian Renaissance were slow to cross the Alps into northern Europe, but important artistic innovations were made also in the Low Countries. Though not – as previously believed – the inventor of oil painting, <a2_0><b6_0><b7_0>Jan van Eyck<b7_0/><b6_0/><a2_0/> was a champion of the new medium, and used it to create works of <a3_0><b8_0>great realism and minute detail<b8_0/><a3_0/>. The two cultures influenced each other and learned from each other, but painting in <a1_0><b5_0>the Netherlands<b5_0/><a1_0/> remained more focused on textures and surfaces than the <a0_0><b4_0>idealized compositions<b4_0/><a0_0/> of Italy.
